Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (17561791) composed several masses and 
separate mass movements (such as Kyrie). Mozart composed most of his masses 
as a church musician in Salzburg: Masses for regular Sundays or smaller feasts 
belonged to the missa brevis ... including a more elaborate orchestration than the 
usual missa brevis.
